page.title: 07HOUSING AND HOME LIFE
page.content:
HOUSING Houses vary in age, size and character; older ones, many listed, are in the long main street. Some are converted barns. Most are owner occupied, a few rented. New detatched or semi-detached houses are concentrated to the north and south. Some houses are scattered in the countryside. Council houses, flats and bungalows for the aged are to the east. The Almshouses of 1612 at the west end are still in use.
HOME LIFE Couples usually co-operate in bringing up the family, and with the help of labour saving devices and electrical gadgets, parents are freer to follow their own careers and interests. Many people keep pets. Gardening is very popular. Retirement at 60/65 with pension ensures a comfortable life for the elderly.
